programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Longtime Tobacco Road rivals duel when No. 7 North Carolina visits No. 9 Duke. The Tar Heels clinched a share of a record 33rd regular-season crown March 5, but the Blue Devils can put a hand on the ACC title by tying UNC at 16-4 in conference play.

programme.title: UFC 299: O'Malley vs. Vera 2 - Prelims
programme.desc: Pedro Munhoz vs. Kyler Phillips, bantamweight; Mateusz Gamrot vs. Rafael Dos Anjos, lightweight; Katlyn Cerminara vs. Maycee Barber, flyweight; Curtis Blaydes vs. Jailton Almeida, heavyweight. From Kaseya Center in Miami.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 5 Wildcats, hoping to play deep into Spring, finish the regular season by visiting the Trojans. On Jan. 17, Arizona collected a sixth straight win over USC with a commanding 82-67 verdict. Arizona senior Caleb Love scored 20 in that contest.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Celtics and Suns tip off in the first of two meetings in six days. The two contenders have split the past five season series. Boston All-Stars Jayson Tatum and Jaylen Brown both reached 25 points in a victorious trip to Phoenix in 2022-23.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: College GameDay
programme.desc: Host Elle Duncan and analysts Andraya Carter, Rebecca Lobo, Carolyn Peck, Holly Rowe and Chiney Ogwumike cover all the angles in women's college basketball with previews, exclusive interviews, analysis, behind-the-scenes features and predictions.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 2 Wolfpack and No. 4 Fighting Irish duke it out in the 2024 ACC Tournament final. NC State seeks its fourth title in five seasons. Notre Dame is in the championship game for the first time since a run of six straight berths ended in 2019.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 1 Gamecocks and No. 2 Tigers meet in the SEC Tournament final. South Carolina needed a buzzer-beating 3-pointer from Kamilla Cardoso to survive No. 5 Tennessee 74-73 and keep their unbeaten season alive. LSU got by No. 3 Ole Miss 75-67.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 1 Cardinal seek a 17th Pac-12 Tournament title as they face the No. 2 Trojans in the final. No other team has more than two. USC's JuJu Watkins, the Pac-12 Freshman of the Year, scored 33 points in a double-overtime semifinal win over UCLA.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: East rivals in the 76ers and Knicks start a two-game series at Madison Square Garden. New York won the first two meetings this season, both in Philadelphia, by a combined 50 points. Knicks guard Jalen Brunson totaled 50 points in those contests.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Timberwolves aim to claim the season series against the Lakers in this match. Minnesota took a pair of contests in Los Angeles' prior stomping grounds in December 2023. Wolves star Anthony Edwards averaged 29 points per game in those wins.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee brings his humor and candor to the microphone to highlight the day's top stories.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter Special
programme.desc: Presenting the latest news from the world of sports.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: From Harrah's Cherokee Center in Asheville, N.C.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 1 Gaels begin their West Coast Conference Tournament with a semifinal showing against the No. 4 Broncos. Saint Mary's seeks a third straight trip to the WCC title game. Santa Clara put up 104 points in a quarterfinal win over No. 5 San Diego.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: From Indiana Farmers Coliseum in Indianapolis.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 11 Bears (22-8, 11-6 Big 12) and Red Raiders (21-9, 10-7) both aim to maintain momentum entering the conference tournament. Texas Tech has won two in a row, but Baylor has three straight wins and defeated the Red Raiders 79-73 on Feb. 6.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 1 Trojans and No. 3 Eagles meet for the 2024 Ohio Valley Conference Tournament title. Little Rock, playing its second OVC season, tries for its first NCAA Tournament berth since 2016. Morehead State last reached the Big Dance floor in 2021.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 4 Broncos duel the No. 5 Toreros in the West Coast Conference Tournament quarterfinals. The teams split two matches this season. The winner plays No. 1 Saint Mary's in the semifinals. San Diego advanced with a 57-52 win over No. 8 Pepperdine.

programme.title: College Basketball Live Scoreboard
programme.desc: All the latest scores and highlights from college basketball.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 6 Pilots take on the No. 3 Dons in the West Coast Conference Tournament quarterfinals. Portland (12-20) stayed alive with a 78-70 win over No. 7 Loyola Marymount in the second round. San Francisco (20-14) beat Portland twice this season.

programme.title: SportsCenter Featured
programme.desc: Unique and compelling feature stories from the world of sports.

programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: Sidney Crosby and the Penguins visit the Bruins for a black-and-gold adorned matinee. Crosby scored the go-ahead goal and provided two assists in Pittsburgh's 6-5 victory at Boston on Jan. 4. The Penguins are mired in a three-game road slide.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Oscar nominee Steve James returns to his hometown of Hampton, Virginia, to take a personal look at a still disputed incident in the life of a young Allen Iverson.

programme.title: Coach K & Roy Williams: Rivals Reunited
programme.desc: Two of the most successful NCAA basketball coaches in history, Mike Krzyzewski and Roy Williams, meet for a rare in-depth conversation, something they never did together during their coaching careers at Duke and North Carolina.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Director Rory Karpf, through interviews with former players and rivals as well as Laettner himself, explores why this former Duke star was, and still is, so disliked.

programme.title: Pickleball
programme.desc: From Johnson Ranch Pickleball Complex in Roseville, Calif.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 5 Lancers play the No. 2 Bulldogs in the Big South Tournament final. Longwood stunned No. 1 seed and host High Point 80-79 in overtime in the semifinals, while UNC Asheville beat No. 3 Gardner-Webb 83-72 in OT on Drew Pember's triple-double.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 2 Hatters and No. 4 Governors play for the Atlantic Sun Tournament championship. Stetson's 88-87 semifinal win over Jacksonville put it in the final for the first time since 2016. Austin Peay eliminated North Alabama for its first title shot.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 1 Spiders and No. 6 Rams battle for the Atlantic 10 Conference Tournament crown and an NCAA Tournament berth. Both schools seek their first title, with Richmond getting its first chance since 2009 and Rhode Island its first since 2003.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Championship.

programme.title: SportsCenter Featured
programme.desc: Unique and compelling feature stories from the world of sports.

programme.title: Men's College Wrestling
programme.desc: From BOK Center in Tulsa, Okla.

programme.title: First Draft
programme.desc: Mel Kiper Jr. joins Field Yates to break down the top prospects in the coming NFL draft.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 4 Cyclones challenge the No. 1 Sooners in this Big 12 Tournament semifinal. Freshman center Audi Crooks' 23 points pushed Iowa State past No. 5 Baylor 67-62 in the quarterfinals, while Oklahoma took care of shorthanded No. 9 TCU 69-53.

programme.desc: All the latest scores and highlights from college basketball.

programme.desc: Second Semifinal.

programme.desc: All the latest scores and highlights from college basketball.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 5 Norse and No. 6 Panthers meet in the Horizon League Tournament semifinals. Both schools pulled off quarterfinal upsets, with Northern Kentucky needing overtime to knock off No. 4 Wright State and Milwaukee dumping rival No. 3 Green Bay.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 2 Bulldogs and the No. 3 Dons do battle in a West Coast Conference Tournament semifinal. Gonzaga has won 27 straight meetings with San Francisco, including five tournament games with the most recent clash coming in last season's semifinal.

programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: The Hoop Collective
programme.desc: Brian Windhorst is joined by Tim MacMahon, Tim Bontemps, and other insiders to sort out life in and around the NBA world.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: In-depth, comprehensive daily coverage of all aspects of the NBA from expert analysts.

programme.title: ESPN BET Live
programme.desc: ESPN Sports Betting Analysts Erin Dolan and Joe Fortenbaugh, along with host Tyler Fulghum, break down the biggest storylines through the lens of sports betting, with breakdowns, discussions and picks.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 1 seed Catamounts cruise into this America East Tournament semifinal against the No. 4 Wildcats. Vermont, the league champs in 2022 and 2023, has won 17 of its past 18 overall. Vermont has also won 18 of the last 19 versus New Hampshire.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 6 Seahawks try to upend the No. 2 Warriors in the Northeast Conference Tournament final. Merrimack, who wore the conference crown in 2023 but was not given an NCAA Tournament berth due to its transition to D-I, lost to Wagner on Jan. 25.

programme.title: NHRA Drag Racing
programme.desc: From Gainesville Raceway in Gainesville, Fla.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Blue Demons get one last chance at a Big East regular-season victory when they visit the Pirates in New Jersey. DePaul sits at 3-27 this campaign, 0-19 in-conference, and is winless in 2024. Seton Hall silenced DePaul 72-39 in Chicago on Jan. 30.

programme.title: FS1 College Hoops Extra
programme.desc: Highlights and analysis of today's college basketball action.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Bruins and the Sun Devils play the final Pac-12 contest of the 2023-24 regular season. UCLA has won seven of its last eight matchups against Arizona State after a 68-66 decision on Jan. 17. Serbian guard Lazar Stefanovic led UCLA with 18 points.

programme.title: NASCAR Xfinity Racing Series
programme.desc: The NASCAR Xfinity Series stays in the desert for the Call 811.com Every Dig. Every Time. 200. John Hunter Nemechek picked up his 10th career Series victory last week in Las Vegas. Sammy Smith took home the checkered flag in Phoenix in 2023.

programme.desc: See highlights from FS1 daily studio shows including "First Things First," "The Herd with Colin Cowherd," "Speak," "The Carton Show," as well as digital podcasts.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: From Phoenix Raceway in Avondale, Ariz.

programme.title: NASCAR Race Hub Presents
programme.desc: Coverage of motorcycle racing action from around the world.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 2 Huskies tune up for the Big East Tournament and beyond by visiting the Friars. Defending national champion UConn beat Providence for the third straight time, 74-65 in January behind point guard Tristen Newton's 16 points and 11 rebounds.

programme.title: NHRA Drag Racing
programme.desc: From Gainesville Raceway in Gainesville, Fla.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 1 Huskies continue their march by facing the No. 5 Golden Eagles in a Big East Tournament semifinal. UConn's quest for a 11th straight conference crown began with an 86-53 romp over No. 9 Providence. Marquette knocked out No. 4 Villanova.

programme.title: Big East Tournament Bridge Show
programme.desc: Analysts review and preview games taking place at the Big East basketball tournament.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Second Semifinal.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 12 Fighting Illini (22-8, 13-6 Big Ten) complete their regular season by visiting the Hawkeyes (18-12, 10-9). Illinois got a 30-point outburst from Coleman Hawkins, a career high for the senior forward, in a 95-85 win over Iowa on Feb. 24.

programme.title: NHRA Drag Racing
programme.desc: From Gainesville Raceway in Gainesville, Fla.

programme.title: NHRA in 30
programme.desc: In the fastest motorsport on earth, things don't always go as planned; relive the NHRA moments that grabbed our attention and see how they walked away.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Badgers (19-11, 11-8) seek revenge on the No. 3 Boilermakers (27-3, 16-3) in a Big Ten finale. Purdue dumped then-No. 6 Wisconsin 75-69 on Feb. 4. The Boilermakers, locked into the conference's top seed, look to polish off a perfect home record.

programme.title: I Am Kevin Harvick
programme.desc: The film chronicles legendary NASCAR champion and FOX Sports' newest NASCAR analyst Kevin Harvick, through his exhilarating racing career and beyond the finish line to unveil the story behind the iconic athlete.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: Kyle Larson comes in hot as the NASCAR Cup Series heads to Phoenix for the Shriners Children's 500. Larson held off Tyler Reddick to win last week's Pennzoil 400 in Las Vegas. William Byron, who won the 2023 races in Las Vegas and Phoenix, was 10th.

programme.desc: Craig Carton, one of New York's best-known voices, analyzes and debates the biggest headlines in sports each morning.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 2 Bluejays play the No. 7 Pirates, for a second straight time, in the Big East Tournament quarterfinals. Creighton won at Seton Hall 72-65 on March 3 for its fifth straight series victory. Seton Hall outlasted DePaul 71-64 in the first round.

programme.title: NHRA Drag Racing
programme.desc: From Gainesville Raceway in Gainesville, Fla.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 3 Red Storm run into the No. 6 Hoyas in the Big East Tournament quarterfinals. Georgetown has won four in a row, a streak that started with a 51-43 victory over St. John's. Red Storm 5-foot-7 senior Unique Drake averages 18 points per game.

programme.title: NHRA Drag Racing
programme.desc: From Gainesville Raceway in Gainesville, Fla.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 8 Golden Eagles look to rebound ahead of the Big East Tournament versus the Musketeers. Marquette's three-game win streak versus Xavier includes an 88-64 decision Feb. 25 and last season's Big East final. The Eagles have dropped two in a row.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Wildcats seek a statement win in this regular-season finale against the No. 10 Bluejays. Villanova's run for a first NCAA Tournament berth for head coach Kyle Neptune goes through Creighton, which fell in a 68-66 overtime battle on Dec. 20, 2023.

programme.desc: The NCAA Tournament bubble-sitting Red Storm host the Hoyas for a Big East game. St. John's has won four straight, starting with a 90-85 triumph over Georgetown. The Red Storm, coached by Rick Pitino, haven't reached the Dance floor since 2019.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 1 Huskies try to keep their grip on the No. 8 Friars as they play a Big East Tournament quarterfinal. UConn has won 35 straight meetings. The Huskies have claimed 10 conference titles in a row, the last three after returning to the Big East.
